Posts.Content: Hi all,  I attend yet another check up in a couple of months, this will be 9 years, I had the works, like most lumpectomy, chemo, radio therapy, followed by 5yrs taking tamox., and arimadex.  I have made the most of the years, now i have a fear of this returning, I can hear my doc saying we think we can keep you here for 10 to 14years, Lymph was involved. Well yes i am lucky to have got this amount of time. Without much trouble, sweats my real problem, anyway shoulders back chest out and on we go, for another good result.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer check up

Posts.Content: Hello all, I am new to all of this new Laptop, Did not know message boards existed. Any way I was diag., B.C. in2001 nearly 6yrs, gosh how time flys . Lumpectomy, lymph involvement,chemo(CMF) radio therapy followed by 2yrs Tamoxifen, 3yrs Arimadex,  go for annual check up July spoke to fellow patient she has been given Femara for a further 2yrs I was so looking forward to getting rid of my SWIMS   has anybody out there  suffered soakings, the least bit of exertion and the water runs down my face.Have tried all medication suggested now taking Megace, if anyone can comment I would be grateful. Talking of gateful nearly 6yrs on and so far O.K. Wishing I had, laptop years ago what a great help.
Posts.Title: Sweats (SWIMS)

Posts.Content: On 3/9/2007 Huey49 wrote: I've been on arimidex almost 2 yrs now. The first 3 months I had no side effects then started having bone pain, getting stiff after sitting too long, trouble getting out of the car, etc. Also fatigue. Just the past few nites, I wake up sweating with my hair soaking wet and my bedding and pajamas damp. I see my oncologist on Monday and will relay all this to him. I was wondering if anyone else is experiencing this while taking arimidex. Thanks, Sandy
Posts.Title: side effects of arimidex

Posts.Content: Dear Huey,       I am nearly 6yrs since diag., B C. I  now have taken Tamoxifen 3 yrs and Arimadex 2yrs  I too have achey  joints but my main problem is drenching sweats day and night, I have tried all prescribed help, and so far nothing has helped me , it is a common problem, and i also would be glad to hear what your oncologist comes up with?  not nice or very sociable, but not painful and we are still here. I do hope you get something that helps you as we are not all the same.  Good Luck will watch  the board.   Ladyrumpers
Posts.Title: side effects of arimidex

Posts.Content: To all bosem buddies on Arimidex or other Aromatase Inhibitors...              I am quite new to this forum, and really tune in quite regularly. I have been reading, that some ladies, have been having a rest from taking Aromatase tablets for one reason or another .I wonder just how common this is?  I have completed 5yrs 3 tam., 2yrs arimidex. I was told last year at my annual check just to stay on until my next appt., July 07  might be put on Femera,patient friend 6mths ahead in treatment told me . How I would love a break from my sweats. should I get in touch with my clinical nurse?    interested in your opinions?      Ladyrumpers.
Posts.Title: A Rest from Aromatase Inhibitors?

Posts.Content: Netterz       I am 6yrs, since diag., and sweats, were a nightmare, you could not call what I have as flashes , flushes , swims more like, I tried Chillow pillow all medication suggested, the only thing that takes the edge of my sweats is Megastrol(megace) you would have to ask your Docs? if it was suitable for you , but I now have a bit of quality in my life. Lady Rumpers
Posts.Title: NEVER ENDING HOT FLASHES !?!?!?!?

Posts.Content: Thanks for input Shelley, its now 12 years since my surgery and treatment, but i wait and see if things get worse, nothing at the moment.
Posts.Title: sharp pin like jab in previous cancer breast.

Posts.Content: has anyone who has had breast cancer. radio therapy on Lumpectomy breast ever had shooting pin pricking sensation in the same breast? grateful for any input.
Posts.Title: sharp pin like jab in previous cancer breast.

Posts.Content: yes I am very lucky, I have had 10yrs since I was diagnosed with breast cancer. I go for my last check up in a weeks time,What then? I worried when my medication came to an end, now I worry my check up is at an end. will have annual mamogram I think, but Oh!! the safety blanket will be gone things are probably done differently I am in Scotland.
Posts.Title: breast cancer survivor

Posts.Content: I was diag., stage 2 agressive,eostrogen res., B.C. lumpectomy, lymph involvement,chemo radio therapy , 3yrs tam., 2yrs arimx., generally kept well apart from sweats took megace improved  slightly. 6years in July since diag., I consider myself really lucky, when I read some of the mail posted here  I have just stopped aromatase therapy and feel scared, my comfort blanket has gone, is this normal, all sorts of things have been going through my mind have i had long enough on arimadex for eg.,  please can WITCH DOCTOR or Other reassure or chase me . thank goodness for this forum  grateful Lady Rumpers
Posts.Title: survivor

Posts.Content: Thank you for your lovely letter.  Think of the good times.
Posts.Title: paddy 01

Posts.Content: While awaiting chemo 6years ago i found this poem in a breast cancer magazine. I dont know who wrote it or the title but i would like to share it with youWe all have a personal mountain to climb, and we all have to take it one step at a time. some mountains are gentle and smooth at the top,others are steep with a terrible drop.You can climb them in tears, with  trembling knees, or pluck up the courage and climb them with ease.The view from the top can be misty or clear, it depends on your outlook is it hope? Is it fear?If you climb with a friend,you can go hand in hand,and the feeling of comradship really is grand.When you,ve conquerd the heights you  might both have a weep,But the path going down does,nt seem quite so steep,So when you are given a mountain to climb,Take some courage, a friend, and one step at a time.
Posts.Title: POEM

Posts.Content: Hello , I am 6yrs survivor, took tamoxifen 3yrs , Arimidex for 2yrs, however I am finished all aromatase therapy last April, I had acheing  joints,insomia, sweats etc., it took around 4months after stopping and i felt wonderful, still have sweats but take Megastrol for this and can cope ok I dont know that we will ever be the same as before but I  have a get up and go Iost while taking Arimidex. Lady Rumpers.
Posts.Title: Side effects of Armidex

Posts.Content: Yes I am well and so pleased to have had no recurrance so far. What are the thoughts of others as to whether a full body MRI would be a good idea of catching something early. I do worry about it coming back as I was told at diagnoses 10-14yrs grateful for any input ? thanks in advace
Posts.Title: 9Years survivor????

Posts.Content: Dear Leemg,  thank you for your reply. Today was my annual checkup ,I explained my problem regarding sweats, asked what the opinion was about continuing Megastrol?  Having been off this for 3months I was surprised to find the answer to be no objection I do not abuse this tablet and when on aromatase tablets cut it back to half a tablet at night . I would like another opinion regarding this as I did have withdraw symptoms when stopping. Lady Rumpers
Posts.Title: Is This The Answer

Posts.Content: I am a breast cancer survivor ofnearly 17 years,recently l have noticed a tiny amount of blood from the nipple of the affected breast,l have an inverted nipple,always have had,anyone got advice?
Posts.Title: Breast,

Posts.Content: I am a breast cancer survivorof 12years. My tumour was oestrogen receptive, I have done really well,my problem is I have had lots of cystitis, and although I have been on an antibiotic 1 at night for a year which has worked very well for me,my urologist wants me to try hormone persaries, I don't know what to do,not happy about taking oestrogen at all.  Would be grateful for any input?
Posts.Title: hormone persaries

Posts.Content: Dear Carolgolf,    Thankyou so much for your reply, I am so pleased , you foundEfexor xr helped you, unfortunately for me I have tried this and it did not help me, However I am grateful  for your help I do hope you keep well on your journey now swimming above the water instead of in it. THANKYOU   Ladyrumpers
Posts.Title: sweats (Swims)

Posts.Content: dear Witchdoctor,  It is now 3months since I finished all Aromatase therapy and Megastrol for sweats my trouble is Iam still having sweats can you tell me if this is a side effect of cancer? I am 58yrs and wonder if it could be a combination of my age---- is there anything I can take for this i do know to stay away from eostrogen products but my sleep is bad due to this and to a certain extent social scene as well. 6yrs since dig., Grateful for advice from you or anyone else even something just to take the edge off I have tried mild ati depress., but not for me.   Lady Rumpers
Posts.Title: Advice on what to do now

Posts.Content: I am a 7year survivor, and am due an annual check up very soon.   Apart from my routine mammogram  i have not had any other scans etc., i wonder if your medical people or anyone for that matter thinks i should ask for a scan? Or leave well alone i come from scotland and am on the wonderful national health  i do mean this as my husband and i have had wonderful care and treatment.  Lady rumpers
Posts.Title: Should I Leave Well Alone?

Posts.Content: On 7/9/2008 sweatylady wrote: Hi, i am 49 was diagnosed with breast cancer on Novemer of 2006. I am now cancer free Thankfully. My treatment was 6 months of chemo and then was put on tamoxifen. 10mg of tamoxifen in the morning and 10mg at night. I am expieriencing TERRIBLE hot flashes. So much so that water comes out of my nose at night and wake up drenched. I complained to my doctor and he then put me on Tramadol. I did some research on his drug and it seem to do the opposite of tamoxifen. Anyone else going through this as well ?????    Hi I go for my 7th year annual check up on the31st July  I wont go into my history but did 3years Tamx  and 2yrs Arimadex I did suffer a selection of side effects joint pain etc., but the one thing that was a major problem was swims not sweats, the only thing that took the edge of for me was Megastrol prescription only, tried 6wks off justabout 2months ago was glad to get back on them they take about a month to make a difference   Lady Rumpers
Posts.Title: SEVERE HOT FLASHES due to tamoxifin

Posts.Content: On 7/9/2008 sweatylady wrote: Hi, i am 49 was diagnosed with breast cancer on Novemer of 2006. I am now cancer free Thankfully. My treatment was 6 months of chemo and then was put on tamoxifen. 10mg of tamoxifen in the morning and 10mg at night. I am expieriencing TERRIBLE hot flashes. So much so that water comes out of my nose at night and wake up drenched. I complained to my doctor and he then put me on Tramadol. I did some research on his drug and it seem to do the opposite of tamoxifen. Anyone else going through this as well ?????    Hi I go for my 7th year annual check up on the31st July  I wont go into my history but did 3years Tamx  and 2yrs Arimadex I did suffer a selection of side effects joint pain etc., but the one thing that was a major problem was swims not sweats, the only thing that took the edge of for me was Megastrol prescription only, tried 6wks off justabout 2months ago was glad to get back on them they take about a month to make a difference   Lady Rumpers
Posts.Title: SEVERE HOT FLASHES due to tamoxifin

Posts.Content: Dear Ookie,  I had breast cancer 8years ago,  I  took Tamoxifen, then Arimadex,  I also had side effects of course anything that can fight CANCER is going to have some sort, If you look back letters on sweats and see my name you can check that i to complained, but I am still here and would rather take my chances with than without drugs or poisens if you want to call it that, There is no cure but THEY  keep us here a lot longer these days. and I am all for that, I dont say I am right but this is my choice. good luck to you no matter what you decide.
Posts.Title: tempted to refurse all drugs

Posts.Content: well this is 8years,and i go tomorrow for my 8th annual checkup, even after this time i still find this checkup buisiness stressful, I have been really lucky, and will never take health for granted. I read all the new postings and some for a second time round. love and best wishes to all boosem buddies.
Posts.Title: luck

Posts.Content: Hi I am a hairdresser, I would ask if the shop would exchange the wig, not refund money, I had chemo 12years ago and bought 2 wigs for the price of a good one, I would say if all else fails go to a hairdresser who does wigs. I have seen the wrong choice of wig chosen so often.
Posts.Title: wig-ged out!

Posts.Content: I think I would get it checked for peace of mind. good luck, I am now 13 years and still worry.
Posts.Title: pain and swelling 15yrs after double mastectomy

Posts.Content: After 3yrs Tamoxifen, 2yrs Arimidex, I have suffered dreadful (SWIMS) ? not sweats, I am offered seats in shops, and have tried all prescribed help nothing seems to help at preasant  Megace, dont really know what to try next annual check up July  spoke to fellow patient  she was given Femera, Dont know if I could put up with another 2years of Sweats any opinion grateful?
Posts.Title: Arimidex vs. Femera

Posts.Content: I am an 8year survivor, and hot hot flushes was my main complaint, I am sorry to say I have been off all cancer medication for 2years and still the flushes come day and night, I did take Arimadex, but might ask my doc about Gabapentin. Having said this sweats are not nice but are not painful. Lots to be thankful for. lady Rumpers
Posts.Title: Arimidex and fish oil taking together

Posts.Content: Hi Georgie   No I have not come off Arimidex  .Although I complain of yuk sweats I would be scared to stop I am more interested in trying to find out if I can cope with extended treatment, I can only think that we are asked to continue because we will have a better chance of non recurrance.  You seem to be changing about a lot  have you not asked why? good to talk to you.  Lady Rumpers
Posts.Title: a rest from aromatase inhibitors

Posts.Content: Dear Witchdoctor or anyone out there who took either ARIMADEX. or MEGASTROL     I took both and am feeling quite  sick, at times is this a withdrawl symptom? I add I am finished my aromatase treatment and took megace to help with sweats. thanks to anyone who can help.    Lady Rumpers
Posts.Title: survivor-withdrawl?
